bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Illness Sign of a sensation of a sour taste on the surface of the tongue despite the fact that one has not ingested any beverage or food. Tai ping hui min he ji Recipe book. Northern Song, ju fang 1107~1110. 太平惠民和劑局方 3: 口苦舌酸，胸滿短氣，肢 體怠惰 , “The mouth is bitter and the tongue has a sour taste . A feeling of fullness in the chest and shortness of qi. The extremities and body slacken”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Bai bing zhu zhi yao 百病主治藥：舌苦是膽熱，甘是脾熱，酸是濕熱，澀 是風熱，辛是燥熱，咸是脾濕，淡是胃虛 , “A bitter taste of the tongue results from gallbladder heat; a sweet taste [of the tongue] results from spleen heat; a sour taste results from moisture heat; a roughness results from wind heat; an acrid taste results from dryness heat; a salty taste results from spleen moisture; a tasteless [tongue] results from stomach depletion”.
